note.p: We have been requested to announce to the Profession in Australasia that Professor R. Virchow, of Berlin, will celebrate his 70th birthday on the 13th October next, and that it is intended to present him, in grateful recognition of his personal merits and of his services in furtherance of medical science, with a large gold portrait medal of 180 m.m. (about seven inches in diameter), to be made by some eminent artist. A large and influential committee has been formed to carry out this intention, the Hon. Treasurer being Mr. Adolph Meyer, 48 Koniggratzer-Strasse, Berlin, S.W., to whom contributions may be sent.

p.seg: [It has also been suggested to us by Baron Sir Ferd. von Mueller, K.C.M.G., F.R.S., M.D., etc., Government Botanist in Melbourne, that perhaps the various medical societies in Australia might combine and send a congratulatory cablegram to Professor Virchow on his coming birthday.]
